quotes.quote: Florida isn't so much a place where one goes to reinvent oneself, as it is a place where one goes if one no longer wished to be found.
We ought to be bragging about Florida!
Florida means land of flowers, not land of ugly.
If you can afford a vacation home in Florida, you should be able to pay the taxes.
Florida is a very healing place.
I live in Florida and people are crazy here. And I say that lovingly.
Florida has tons of entertainment opportunities because Walt Disney World and Universal Studios are there.
I am absolutely convinced that Florida will become the most exciting place in the world to live and work.

Florida is a place of unparalleled diversity of backgrounds, experiences and vision. It makes our culture unique, but it can also make it difficult to define a common identity and create a sense of community that reaches beyond our neighborhoods to all corners of our state.
It's always sunny in the Sunshine State. Except for at night.
My love for you is like a Florida sunset. Orange, coral, pink, and lavender, it exists to warm your heart through the inevitable darkness.
August in Florida is God's way of reminding us who's in charge.
Florida is a strange place: hot, beautiful, ugly. I love it here, and how nothing makes sense but still, somehow, there is a rhythm.
My parents didn't want to move to Florida, but they turned sixty and that's the law.
The Florida sun seems not much a single thing overhead but a set of klieg lights that pursue you everywhere with an even white illumination.
I go to Florida sometimes for vacation. I actually really like Florida. It's a weird place, it's surreal. It's so close, but you feel like you're in another world or on an island.
The one thing I did learn at Florida State, I learned to talk trash, believe that.

Florida has its own rhythm, too. People go to work, they watch their children learn and grow and start families of their own. They play in the sun and pass their lives enjoying the outsized blessings that make our state unique.
I like Florida. Everything is in the 80's. The temperatures, the ages and the IQ's.
Sometimes I think I've figured out some order in the universe, but then I find myself in Florida.
I couldn't adjust to the racism in Florida.
Every child in South Florida can dance. And every child there is amazing.
Here in Florida, we have something special we never enjoyed at Disneyland...the blessing of size. There's enough land here to hold all the ideas and plans we can possibly imagine.
We are not exposed to ice much in Florida.
I represent Orlando, Florida, the world's number one vacation destination.
Florida...does beguile and gratify me—giving me my first and and last (evidently) sense of the tropics, or a peu pres, the sub tropics, and revealing to me blandness in nature of which I had no idea.
The state with the prettiest name, the state that floats in brackish water, held together by mangrove roots.
Florida is the world's greatest amusement park.
Florida is a golden word...The very name Florida carried the message of warmth and ease and comfort. It was irresistible.
I wonder if the people who live in the great state of Florida know why they are able to get their initials on their license plates.
I happen to know that Florida is now working on something that could revolutionize its real estate market. It's an alligator that eats crabgrass.
There is only one problem in taking a winter vacation in Florida. You spend two weeks getting a deep, rich, golden tan— then they hand you the bill and you're pale again.
In all fairness, he did warn me. I asked him if you could get along in Florida on sixty-five dollars a day. He said, 'If you're an alligator, yes. If you're a tourist, no.'
I won't comment on the weather we had. Did you know they named a wine after the first bird who ever flew down to Florida for the winter? Cold duck.
Florida is a wasteland as a result of the Great Freeze of the last fall.  Almost all of the Australian pines were killed.
As the immense dew of Florida / Brings forth / The big-finned palm / And green vine angering for life.
As the immense dew of Florida / Brings forth hymn and hymn / From the beholder, / Beholding all these green sides / And gold sides of green sides.
To Michigan, Florida perfumes shall tenderly come; / Not the perfumes of flowers, but sweeter, and wafted beyond death.
As amazing as it seems, the state of Florida must certainly be one of the most haunted places in the United States,
When most people think of Florida, they may think of warm, sunny beaches, vacation attractions, and the night life it has to offer.
Florida was also very hot and full of mosquitoes and strange creatures such as alligators.
Many Spaniards had a hard time earning a living in Florida. The soil along the coast was not good for growing crops, so they were forced to move farther inland.
The Florida skies are like no other, with cloud formations that are awesome! Even when it rains, the sun shines through the drops.
It's got a good climate you need for all the water sports, plus tennis, swimming, running. It's kind of relaxing on the shore. It's pretty laid back, listening to the water, watching the sunset.
I came from Michigan seven years ago, and every year I learn to love the winters in Florida even more.
For a lot of people in different times in their life, Florida represents a new start.
There are only five bad weather days a year here in Florida, and they aren't even that bad.
Florida is different things to different people. To some, Florida is a paradise. It is warm water, sun-drenched beaches, mysterious swamps, and stunning coral reefs.
It is small towns, pickup trucks, and tomato fields. To still others, it is a vacationland with high-rise hotels, amusement parks, and bumper-to-bumper traffic.
Florida is a cultural crossroads where people of different backgrounds have mingled, traded, and sometimes fought.
When automobile came into popularity, Florida was among the first to begin work on a network of good roads.
No winter coats in Florida, no boots, no chains, no salt, no plows and shovels. In the balmy state of Florida, fruits fell in the meanest yard.
